review_title: Easy student job, good work environment
pros: You can set up your hours according to your courses and the supervisor is very receptive of any issues brought up. Many issues from the Fall have been resolved. The people are diverse and it is super friendly.
cons: Not always a lot to do or a lot of people passing through. Sometimes the slow days are a benefit if you have a lot of schoolwork.

pros: Fun job with lots of opportunity to travel
cons: Heavy workload and expectation from administration

review_title: A very positive experience for college students needing hourly, on-campus employment
pros: Flexible hours, great staff, positive team
cons: Each day or shift can look rather different, not great pay

job_title: Director of Operations in York, PA
pros: - Good amount of PTO - Decent benefits
cons: - Poor salary ranges with little to no opportunity for raises - Benefits dwindling with the college tightening its belt - Poor work-life balance

pros: amazing people - down to earth
cons: low pay for volume of work

job_title: Various Positions Held in York, PA
pros: YCP is a wonderful employer. I worked there as a student and they were always very flexible with my hours. It was also a very warm and wonderful environment to work in.
cons: Pay wasn’t great but I was a student worker so it was expected

pros: Teaching is a good profession.
cons: Low salary is not as good as the market.

job_title: Enrollment Communication Specialist in York, PA
pros: Company culture is good, people are friendly, students are great. The 401k match is great.
cons: I didn't have any opportunities for advancement in my position. When I was offered another role the employer came back with a disrespectful counteroffer to try and get me to stay. They don't know how to keep young talent.

pros:
Autonomy in my job. 
Director is extremely supportive.
cons:
Overall, YCP is probably 20 years behind where it should be. 
Administrators are not equitably compensated to Faculty.
Benefits constantly changing and controlled by Faculty.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in York, PA
pros: Small community, room for growth
cons: Very insulated, clicky, poor morale and negative culture.

review_title: Good pay. No guarantee no of work.
pros: Pay, Flexible schedules, Friendly students
cons: Courses cancelled if not enrolled and no replacement course offered

job_title: Student Tour Guide in York, PA
pros: They were flexible with school schedule
cons: Sometimes not enough notice before scheduled tour

pros: The boss for the Lab room of which I worked was very smart loves a fast paced environment but is willing to help if someone has a drive to learn a great deal. This gave a great opportunity to learn with the newest technology and get hopefully a jump on others in my field.
cons: it is a college and there are no so great professors to work for or with who are very demanding of things that they do not understand or understand that there is no budget and every video is done by what can be gotten for free or very cheep. This seems to escapee some of the professors.

pros: As an adjunct, the per course pay is excellent, and the school has excellent facilities. I feel as if the school does a fine job with the student costs. I feel supported by my superiors, in spite of my part-time status
cons: Sometimes I have classes back to back in separate buildings, which makes class setup inconvenient. This is compounded when  I'm in a classroom with old technology. Although staff does an outstanding job of providing necessary equipment, the setup time takes a minute or two out of my class time. Also, adjuncts can't use the gym.

pros:
Colleagues are best in the business
Beautiful surrounding area
Close to BWI (< 1 hr)
Historically, lots of freedom to develop own program
Historically, excellent health benefits
cons:
Administrators are terrible
College enrollment in decline over past 5 years
Strategically weak and dangerously behind the curve in some basics
May not pay industry-level wages in certain areas
Threatening to decrease benefits, potentially cut some programs

review_title: York College of Pennsylvania has one of the best education programs ever.
pros: Professors are willing to work with you. The classroom sizes are small and personal. Many school experiences and opportunities are offered.
cons: After graduating I was on my own getting my actual teaching certificate, but I met all requirements thanks to YCP.

review_title: The college was a great place to work.
job_title: Customer Service Manager in York, PA
pros: Excellent benefits package was a huge factor for working at the college. The work/life balance was a plus as well.
cons: The college is out dated in certain aspects. There are older employees who should have retired years ago that need to be replaced.

review_title: I love teaching at York College
pros: The students inspire you every day you work with them, the pay is pretty good for adjunct faculty members and the other professors are also great to work with.
cons: No medical benefits for adjunct faculty members.

pros: York College offers some great benefits for its faculty.
cons: The administration is trying to reduce benefits.

review_title: Great place to work and flexible hours
pros: flexible hours and the ability to review coursework
cons: typically you are not able to schedule many hours

pros: Its a pleasant campus in a small city. They have built a number of newer facilities.
cons: The were going through some re-organization. I had 5 different department heads in 5 years.

job_title: Biology Lab Assistant in York, PA
pros: I was able to help student and gain experience.
cons: I have no cons about working and obtaining a degree at York College.

pros: Great people and one of the best bosses I've had.  Great leader.  Felt like family there.
cons: Sometimes gets slow but that's ok.

pros: flexible hours. Allowed to take off whenever your class schedule becomes tough
cons: having to wake up early in the morning

pros: Fellow professors are very friendly and the students are dedicated and bright.
cons: No cons to speak of

pros: good teamwork environment. location, benefits
cons: salary ability to move up.

pros: Fun environment, independent, Got to make own hours
cons: Low pay, otherwise it was pretty good.

job_title: Front Desk Attendant in York, PA
pros: Absolutely Loved the job and the position. It was a perfect experience.
cons: I have nothing to complain about.

pros: Easy hours, not much supervision
cons: Boring, not much too do

pros: better than UPS or Walmart
cons: very low pay (and not just for academics), incompetent leadership

pros: Great learning experiences for a student

pros: Easy work, Laid back, Fun
